item.title: Linus Tech Tips Thinks the Steam Machine Price Will be Around $700
item.content:encoded:
In a new video posted to their YouTube channel, Linus Tech Tips has broken down the cost of the hardware that will be added to the Steam Machine to get a sense of how much the console be priced. Spoiler alert… It’s likely to be much more than people thought online.

According to Linus Tech Tips, the parts at their historical low price will cost around $602, but that number has increased significantly in recent months by a whopping 50%, bringing the price to around $900.

As Linus Tech Tips rightfully pointed out, though, these prices are for name brands, and they think the cost can be reduced to around $813 at retail. However, Valve does have a direct-to-consumer model, meaning that it doesn’t need the traditional retailer margins of around 10%.

The question is then, how much profit does Valve want per console? Traditionally, console manufacturers have subsidised or even taken a loss on their consoles, while subscription models and software are their profit centres.

Steam Machine Will Cost $700?

The conclusions led Linus Tech Tips to believe that the Steam Machine will cost approximately $699, if the hardware prices remain at the prices they do today. Linus Tech Tips then went on to say $800 at most if the hardware market continues to climb at the unprecedented rate it has been going. That could be a hard sell when the PlayStation 5 is only $399 at the moment.

And remember… This is for a model with a 500GB SSD… Not 1TB / 2TB.

You can watch Linus Tech Tips’ full analysis and breakdown below:

Personally, though, I think that the Steam Machine might be a little pricier. I would think that $799-849 would be the 512GB version, with a 2TB costing $999. But then and again, maybe I am just a little loopy when it comes to pricing.

item.title: MOZA AB6 Flight Simulator Review—A New Level of Immersion
item.content:encoded:
It’s been around 4 weeks since I unboxed and started playing with the AB6 flight simulator bundle from MOZA, and it’s a true step up in terms of quality and immersion from what I’ve been using previously. For complete transparency, I am not a tried-and-tested flight simulator enthusiast with years of experience; in fact, I only got into flight simulators in the past 12 months thanks to my 9-year-old son, who is obsessed with planes. So naturally, as an adult who loves his toys… I couldn’t just let him have all the fun.

Nearly $1500 later, and we finally have a decent flight simulator setup, but when MOZA contacted me to try out their new AB6 flight, I jumped at the chance.

MOZA has been in both the flight and racing simulator scenes for several years, and their AB9 flight stick was very well received in the flight simulator community. With the AB6, they’ve opted for a more affordable offering at $399. For those not in the flight simulator community, it’s a price tag that might seem steep, but compared to other products on the market that offer similar features, it really is a good deal.

A Fully-Immersive Product

One of the key highlights of the MOZA AB6 is a force-feedback flight base that delivers up to 6 Nm of peak torque—roughly half the output of the AB9. While on paper that is a huge difference, the competitive price and inclusion of the flight stick as a part of the bundle (which does not apply to the AB9), it is a good compromise. Remember that the AB6 is aimed at getting people into the hobby at a competitive price, rather than pricing them out.

What I will say is that the force feedback completely changed the immersion for both my son and me, and I don’t think either of us wants to go back to what we were using. In fact, I would recommend anything to get into the hobby with force feedback at the start, rather than wasting money further on down the line.

One of the things I was massively unaware of with the AB6 is that you can also change it into a shifter if you’re also into race simulation. So, if you’re like me and are sick of changing parts around, the MOZA AB6 makes it relatively easy to change a few settings and swap out the flightstick for a shifter and go from in the air to on the ground.

AB6 Specifications

AB6 Overall Thoughts

Again, I am not a fully-fledged flight simulator enthusiast, but if you’re like me with a year or so in the cockpit, I couldn’t recommend the AB6 by MOZA enough. The production quality and immersion that the AB6 brings you is such a massive step up from the more common flight simulator products that most people start off with, that I do think it’s worth spending an additional $100 or so to get the full bang for your buck on what the hobby can offer.

You can check out MOZA’s AB6 and other products over on their Amazon page here.

item.title: Razer Blackshark V3 PRO—Even Better Than Brilliant
item.content:encoded:
The Razer Blackshark V2 Pro was my go-to headset for the longest time, and it was also the pick of many of the world’s best esports pro players. That’s why I was elated when Razer revealed the Blackshark V3 Pro, the next generation of the award-winning headset, packed with upgraded technology but retaining the classic, flawless aesthetic that we all knew and loved.

The Razer Blackshark V3 Pro is out now and selling like hot cakes. In this review, I’m breaking down exactly why this headset is worth every penny of the somewhat expensive price tag.

Is the Razer Blackshark V3 Pro Worth $269.99?

At the time of writing this review, the Razer Blackshark V3 Pro had a price tag of $269.99, which might seem exorbitant to some. However, the technology that’s packed into this headset more than makes the tag worthwhile, and there’s a reason why the world’s best pro players, especially those in the Call of Duty space, rely on this device.

Let’s start with the fundamentals. This is a wireless ANC headset, which means that when you’re playing, you’re unencumbered by cables and you won’t hear a thing around you. You’re completely in the zone and loving life, and that’s what this headset is all about.

It uses Razer’s Hyperspeed technology to ensure you’re getting low-latency connections that deliver your audio as clearly and efficiently as possible, which is of the utmost importance for any gamer, as audio desync is a harrowing issue that prevents the pinnacle of performance being delivered.

If you’re playing as part of a team, you’ve got the Hyperclear, detachable boom mic, which has a fat pop filter to keep your vocals clean and your callouts succinct. I used the boom mic on a range of software to test it out, from OBS to Audacity, and from Discord to in-game voice chats, and I can confirm it’s just as clear as most desktop podcast microphones, which is nice.

The Razer Blackshark V3 Pro comes in a range of designs, from black to white, and from ‘esports green’ to a special-edition Counter-Strike 2 version. I’m a huge fan of the esports green variant, which is available exclusively from Razer, but for my review of this headset, I used the clean white version.

For this new generation of the Razer Blackshark headset, the tech titan has pumped new technology behind the cups. The extremely capable drivers have been tweaked to reduce harmonic distortion, the bass range has been improved, and the directional audio capabilities are second-to-none, thanks to the THX Spatial on-board mechanics.

Put simply, you’ll hear a foot scraping on the floor across the map and be able to pinpoint exactly where it came from.

It gets better, though.

The Razer Blackshark V3 Pro has quad mode connectivity, which means it can work with 2.4Ghz wireless bands, Bluetooth, USB inputs, or via a 3.5mm cable. The battery is also nuts, and without ANC turned on, you can get up to 70 hours of battery life. The only negative I have about the headset is that it could really do with a dock of some kind to make charging more ‘comfortable’ and seamless.

That’s why I love the Astro A50 Gen 5, after all.

Interchangeable faceplates, app control, customization through the Razer Synapse software, and incredible levels of comfort thanks to a low-weight profile and comfy cushioning all come together to make this one of the best headsets on the market right now for both casual and pro gamers.

Don’t sleep on the Razer Blackshark V3 Pro.

item.title: Razer Raiju V3 PRO Review—An Elite Alternative to Scuf and Battle Beaver
item.content:encoded:
If you’re in the market for a ‘pro-grade’ controller and are considering a Scuf or a Battle Beaver, put those thoughts on hold. Instead, take a look at the Razer Raiju V3 Pro, an all-new device that’s customizable, capable, and created by the best technical minds at Razer, one of the most reputable gaming brands around.

In this Razer Raiju V3 Pro review, I’ll help you understand why this is one of the best alternatives to the eye-wateringly expensive pro controllers on the market, and why it’s definitely worth your investment.

Is the Razer Raiju V3 Pro Worth $219.99?

The Razer Raiju V3 Pro will set you back a pretty penny, but it’s worth every cent. I’ve been trialling this wonderful controller for a couple of weeks on both PlayStation and PC as I write this, and I have had a brilliant time. I’ve used it across Battlefield 6, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, and ARC Raiders, and in every situation put before me, the controller has excelled.

Let’s start with the build.

The controller is bigger than your average Dualsense controller, but it uses a similar mapping in terms of thumbsticks and face buttons. It has the classic trackpad that you’ve learned to associate with PlayStation controllers, but the triggers and shoulder buttons are more reminiscent of an Xbox controller. It’s the perfect hybrid, in my eyes.

You’ve got two extra buttons alongside the shoulder inputs, and up to four tactile inputs on the back, all of which are hot-swappable and customizable in a matter of seconds.

The thumbsticks are modular and can be swapped out just as quickly, and you get extras in the attractive carry pack that the controller comes in to suit your needs.

Additionally, almost every input on the controller is ‘mouse-click’ in build, the triggers come with stops that you can switch on and off to suit your game, and the entire thing is wrapped up in a comfortable, durable shell that looks great and feels nice in your hands.

It’s as premium as you can get, and it still comes in under the cost of a Scuf or a Battle Beaver.

But wait, there’s more!

The Razer Raiju V3 Pro can be further adjusted with Razer’s Synapse software, which includes creating on-board profiles, setting actuation points, adjusting deadzones, remapping inputs, and so on.

If you want to use the controller wirelessly on a PS5, you’re covered. If you’d rather go wired on a PC, you can do that too – and you can switch between those inputs easily enough. The Razer Raiju V3 Pro is marketed as a ‘lag-free, esports-grade’ device, which means you have lightning-fast response times and super-low latency inputs.

It’s expensive, but that’s the point. It’s a premium controller that’ll suit the best pro players in the world, and it has been crafted in collaboration with those very competitors, especially in the Call of Duty space. It takes a while to get used to the inputs if you’ve never used a controller like this, but it’s well worth investing that time to seek those results in-game.

I can’t fault the Razer Raiju V3 Pro controller, and that’s rare for me when it comes to reviewing peripherals.

item.title: Best Gifts for Streamers & Content Creators 2025
item.content:encoded:
The competitive nature of streaming and content creation in the modern day means having the right equipment and set-up is invaluable, which means that gifts for streamers and content creators in 2025 can make a big difference.

Insider Gaming has collated the list below to showcase some of the top picks for gifts for anyone you know who is a streamer or content creator this holiday season, covering all budgets.

Don’t forget to check out Insider Gaming’s other holiday 2025 guides for more gift ideas and some of the best deals around.

Best 2025 Gifts for Streamers & Content Creators

Elgato Stream Deck Mk. 2

The Stream Deck is a must-have item for any streamer, and while other products might offer the same service, it’s the best in the market. With programmable buttons that make it easier to switch between scenes, trigger on-screen effects, and more, it’s one of the best gifts for streamers.

Custom Gamer Tag Neon Sign

Anyone looking to jazz up their streaming set up should definitely take a look at the Custom Gamer Tag Neon Sign, which lights up the room and simultaneously acts as promotion for their brand. It’s the perfect background for a streamer, as it easily promotes their account in any clips that are cut.

The Ultimate Streamer’s Log Book

Keeping ideas fresh is a tough challenge for any streamer or content creator, and finding the right approach can be tricky. That’s where The Ultimate Streamer’s Log Book comes in handy, providing over 100 stream challenges to help you stay organized and come up with fresh approaches.

KDD Headset Stand With Charging Station

Any streamer or content creator needs to ensure they have all their required equipment fully charged and ready to go, which is where the KDD Headset Stand comes in perfectly. Equipped with 2 USB and 1 type-C charging port, it can be used to charge smartphones, tablets, headphones, controllers, and more, making it among the best gifts for streamers.

Overhead Camera Mount with Ring Light

If you’re thinking of doing top-down content, like pack openings or drawings, an overhead camera with a light is a must-have, and this has both in one. Compatible with iPhone and Logitech webcams, among others, this camera mount attaches to the desk and provides everything you need for a quick set-up.

PQRQP 3-in-1 Wireless Lavalier Microphone

Recording content on the go means you should have a clippable microphone to block out background noise and focus on exactly the source you want, and this 3-in-1 microphone presents an affordable option. Compatible with iPhone, Android, cameras, and more, it’s the perfect tool for content creating on the go.

Frigidaire Retro 9-Can Personal Fridge

Long sessions on stream or editing content can be taxing, and you don’t want to have to keep on going in and out for refreshments. A mini fridge on hand is therefore advised, and the Frigidaire Retro 9-Can Personal Fridge has enough room to keep you going in a long stint, and a nice design to boot.

Elgato Prompter

Keeping engaged with chat is crucial for any live streamer or content creator, but you don’t want to crank your neck turning your head to different monitors. The Elgato prompter counters that, showing a live feed of chat to interact with, or, if recording content, showing a script to follow.

Neewer Collapsible Backdrop

A green screen might not be an immediate necessity but, once you start using it, you’ll never look the other way again. The Neewer Collapsible Backdrop has both green and blue screen, coming double-sided, and is easy to put up and store, all available for a decent price.

Elgato 4K S External Capture Card

A capture card is one of the most important items for any streamer or content creators, as it quickly captures all content from an external source, like a console, and connects it to PC and your stream. Without it, you’ll be limited on your options when streaming, and it should be one of the first things you pick up when you get started.

item.title: Best Family-Friendly Games 2025: Holiday Guide
item.content:encoded:
The holiday season is the perfect time to gather around a console with loved ones to tackle multiplayer titles, both co-operatively and competitively, and there are some great family-friendly titles on the market in 2025.

From famous franchises to titles that may have gone under your radar, there’s a wide array of family-friendly games to try out this holiday season, and Insider Gaming has gathered some of the best options across multiple platforms.

Don’t forget to check out Insider Gaming’s other holiday 2025 guides for game suggestions and some of the best deals available!

Best Family-Friendly Games 2025

Super Mario Party Jamboree

The Super Mario Party franchise has been among the greatest games to play with family over the years, and it’s no different with the latest entry, Jamboree. Available on Nintendo Switch platforms, Jamboree is packed with over 110 minigames, more than any other title in the franchise’s history.

Overcooked! All You Can Eat

If you still haven’t played the Overcooked! games in 2025, you’re really missing out. Thankfully, the All You Can Eat edition is the perfect solution, as it includes both the original game and the sequel, along with all additional content. The variety of levels will put your teamwork to the test, and it won’t take long for you to find a favorite among the loveable characters.

Moving Out

A game with a similar vibe to Overcooked! Moving Out is a co-operative game based around helping people pack up their belongings and move house, but there are always some tricks in store. Some objects require careful movement, others are easy to break, and every level has hidden objectives to discover for bonus rewards.

PowerWash Simulator 2

Don’t knock it until you’ve tried it. PowerWash Simulator 2 is the perfect calm to wind down during the frantic holiday season, offering an array of levels to test your cleaning abilities with, more tools for the job than you will ever need, and extreme satisfication when you complete every level.

LEGO Party!

The new market competitor to Super Mario Party, LEGO Party! offers similar gameplay experiences, but in brick form. The 4-player party game is available on most platforms, a huge advantage with Super Mario Party being Nintendo exclusive, and offers 60 minigames to compete against each other in the wacky Challenge Zones.

Mario Kart World

A Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive, Mario Kart World is the long-awaited latest entry in the Mario Kart franchise, and is stacked full of tracks to compete on, and a vast open world to explore. As you’d expect, the title is filled with all your favorite characters from the Mario franchise, and there are plenty of costumes and variants to discover along the way.

Minecraft

Minecraft continues to be one of the best family-friendly games available on the market, providing an entire sandbox to play in. Whether you want to explore or build, or beat the game by defeating the Ender Dragon, Minecraft has endless hours of entertainment, and is one of the best multiplayer games you can get.

Astro Bot

The 2024 platform game from Team Asobi is a PlayStation 5 exclusive and stands as one of the best games available on the platform. With over 50 planets to complete, each filled with a tough course to navigate and boss battles, there’s plenty to tick off, and the game is a who’s who in PlayStation history with bot versions of a host of famous characters from a variety of franchise.

Disney Dreamlight Valley

Disney Dreamlight Valley is effectively Animal Crossing with Disney characters, putting players in charge of building a village filled with fan-favorite characters from Disney and Pixar titles, including the big names from Frozen, Moana, Toy Story, the Lion King, and more. With a host of mini-quests to complete, and plenty to collect, Dreamlight Valley is a game that sucks you in quickly.

Ultimate Chicken Horse

Those looking for a different sort of competitive title this holiday season should take a look at Ultimate Chicken Horse, a platform game with a difference. Each round, every player selects an item to add to the course that can make completing it easier or more difficult. It brings out a different sort of competitive edge, and an endless gameplay loop.

What family-friendly games would you recommend for the holiday season? Share your suggestions in the Insider Gaming Discord.
